revised_title: Synthesis and Properties of Pyridine Dibromide
tldr: The author, John Davidson, describes the synthesis of a new bromide compound formed by reacting pyridine with dibromide of ethylene. The resulting crystalline mass has unique solubility properties and a complex molecular structure. The author also discusses the formation of other compounds, such as the dichloride and platinum-salt, and compares the stability of this pyridine derivative to other ethylated bases.
